topic.title: To register your org with Power Upgrade Program for auto-upgrade

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: To register your org with Power Upgrade Program for auto-upgrade

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Provides steps to register your org for the Power Upgrade Program to enable automatic upgrades and run validation tests.

context.p: This section provides a high-level flow of the org registration process and early feedback programs. Refer to Power Upgrade Program documentation for a comprehensive overview of features.

li.p: Launch the Power Upgrade Program's registration page .
Select your Salesforce org type (Production or Sandbox).
li.stepresult: The Salesforce login page is displayed.

li.p: Enter your credentials and click Login.
li.stepresult: You are redirected to the connected app called Power Push Upgrade CA, which prompts you to allow access to the org information.
The org registration form is displayed.

li.p: Click Set Package Access Control to set the accessibility for Power packages to be upgraded with Power Upgrade Program.

p.p: The Early Feedback pop-up is displayed. In addition, Power sends an email notification to the system administrator on successful registration with a list of packages (including dependent packages, if any) handled in the upgrade process.

note.p: The early feedback program executes a test suite to check if the customizations in your org are compatible with the upgrade. For more information, see the Power Automation Early Feedback program.

li.p: Click Try Now. A Power Automation Dashboard is displayed with a Quick Guide pop-up. Click Yes to go through the quick tour of the dashboard.
Click Click to see the test to view a list of tests to be executed for your org.
li.stepresult: A List of Tests pop-up is displayed.

li.p: Enter your Email ID and Organization Name. You can enter multiple email ids.

li.stepresult: Power sends a welcome email to the email ids entered in the previous step with a list of tests performed in the early feedback program.
A Power Services Test Automation Execution Page is displayed.

li.p: Click the checkbox next to the Job ID and click Begin Test Execution to run the predefined automated test suite against your org.
For the latest information on Power Upgrade Program, see Power Upgrade Program documentation .
